page.title: 11LOCAL SERVICES
page.content: In the Langford Budville area we only have one Post Office which sells a few groceries, cigarettes, sweets, ice- creams and a little stationary. At the Post Office counter stamps can be bought, parcels sent, and money obtained for pensions, and from savings. A mobile baker and fishman visit the village and the surrounding area. The baker comes twice a week and the fishman only once. The baker does not just sell bread but also cakes, crisps and a few sweets. The milkman delivers milk daily to everyone's house and also sells groceries. In the summer an ice-cream van visits the village every day just when the children come out of school. Every three weeks a travelling library stops in each village for people to exchange the books they have borrowed.
